GLOBAL.description: Options to control the overall behavior of Pants.

build_file_prelude_globs.description:
Python files to evaluate and whose symbols should be exposed to all BUILD files
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#build_file_prelude_globs

build_ignore.description:
Path globs or literals to ignore when identifying BUILD files
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#build_ignore

build_patterns.description:
The naming scheme for BUILD files, i.e. where you define targets
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#build_patterns

ca_certs_path.description:
Path to a file containing PEM-format CA certificates used for verifying secure connections when downloading files required by a build
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#ca_certs_path

cache_content_behavior.description:
Controls how the content of cache entries is handled during process execution
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#cache_content_behavior

colors.description:
Whether Pants should use colors in output or not
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#colors

docker_execution.description:
If true, `docker_environment` targets can be used to run builds inside a Docker container
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#docker_execution

dynamic_ui.description:
Display a dynamically-updating console UI as Pants runs
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#dynamic_ui

dynamic_ui_renderer.description:
If `--dynamic-ui` is enabled, selects the renderer
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#dynamic_ui_renderer

engine_visualize_to.description:
A directory to write execution and rule graphs to as `dot` files
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#engine_visualize_to

ignore_warnings.description:
Ignore logs and warnings matching these strings
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#ignore_warnings

keep_sandboxes.description:
Controls whether Pants will clean up local directories used as chroots for running processes
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#keep_sandboxes

local_cache.description:
Whether to cache process executions in a local cache persisted to disk at `--local-store-dir`
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#local_cache

local_execution_root_dir.description:
Directory to use for local process execution sandboxing
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#local_execution_root_dir

local_store_dir.description:
Directory to use for the local file store, which stores the results of subprocesses run by Pants
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#local_store_dir

local_store_directories_max_size_bytes.description:
The maximum size in bytes of the local store containing directories
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#local_store_directories_max_size_bytes

local_store_files_max_size_bytes.description:
The maximum size in bytes of the local store containing files
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#local_store_files_max_size_bytes

local_store_processes_max_size_bytes.description:
The maximum size in bytes of the local store containing process cache entries
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#local_store_processes_max_size_bytes

local_store_shard_count.description:
The number of LMDB shards created for the local store
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#local_store_shard_count

log_levels_by_target.description:
Set a more specific logging level for one or more logging targets
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#log_levels_by_target

log_show_rust_3rdparty.description:
Whether to show/hide logging done by 3rdparty Rust crates used by the Pants engine
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#log_show_rust_3rdparty

logdir.description:
Write logs to files under this directory
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#logdir

loop.description:
Run goals continuously as file changes are detected
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#loop

loop_max.description:
The maximum number of times to loop when `--loop` is specified
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#loop_max

named_caches_dir.description:
Directory to use for named global caches for tools and processes with trusted, concurrency-safe caches
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#named_caches_dir

pants_bin_name.description:
The name of the script or binary used to invoke Pants
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#pants_bin_name

pants_distdir.description:
Write end products, such as the results of `pants package`, to this dir
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#pants_distdir

pants_ignore.description:
Paths to ignore for all filesystem operations performed by pants (e.g
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#pants_ignore

pants_ignore_use_gitignore.description:
Include patterns from `.gitignore`, `.git/info/exclude`, and the global gitignore files in the option `[GLOBAL].pants_ignore`, which is used for Pants to ignore filesystem operations on those patterns
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#pants_ignore_use_gitignore

pants_physical_workdir_base.description:
When set, a base directory in which to store `--pants-workdir` contents
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#pants_physical_workdir_base

pants_subprocessdir.description:
The directory to use for tracking subprocess metadata
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#pants_subprocessdir

pants_workdir.description:
Write intermediate logs and output files to this dir
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#pants_workdir

pantsd.description:
Enables use of the Pants daemon (pantsd). pantsd can significantly improve runtime performance by lowering per-run startup cost, and by memoizing filesystem operations and rule execution
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#pantsd

pantsd_invalidation_globs.description:
Filesystem events matching any of these globs will trigger a daemon restart
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#pantsd_invalidation_globs

pantsd_max_memory_usage.description:
The maximum memory usage of the pantsd process
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#pantsd_max_memory_usage

pantsd_pailgun_port.description:
The port to bind the Pants nailgun server to
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#pantsd_pailgun_port

pantsd_timeout_when_multiple_invocations.description:
The maximum amount of time to wait for the invocation to start until raising a timeout exception
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#pantsd_timeout_when_multiple_invocations

pantsrc.description:
Use pantsrc files located at the paths specified in the global option `pantsrc_files`
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#pantsrc

pantsrc_files.description:
Override config with values from these files, using syntax matching that of `--pants-config-files`
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#pantsrc_files

plugins.description:
Allow backends to be loaded from these plugins (usually released through PyPI). The default backends for each plugin will be loaded automatically
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#plugins

plugins_force_resolve.description:
Re-resolve plugins, even if previously resolved
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#plugins_force_resolve

print_stacktrace.description:
Print the full exception stack trace for any errors
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#print_stacktrace

process_execution_cache_namespace.description:
The cache namespace for process execution
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#process_execution_cache_namespace

process_execution_graceful_shutdown_time.description:
The time in seconds to wait when gracefully shutting down an interactive process (such as one opened using `pants run`) before killing it
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#process_execution_graceful_shutdown_timeout

process_execution_local_enable_nailgun.description:
Whether or not to use nailgun to run JVM requests that are marked as supporting nailgun
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#process_execution_local_enable_nailgun

process_execution_local_parallelism.description:
Number of concurrent processes that may be executed locally
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#process_execution_local_parallelism

process_execution_remote_parallelism.description:
Number of concurrent processes that may be executed remotely
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#process_execution_remote_parallelism

process_per_child_memory_usage.description:
The default memory usage for a single "pooled" child process
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#process_per_child_memory_usage

process_total_child_memory_usage.description:
The maximum memory usage for all "pooled" child processes
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#process_total_child_memory_usage

pythonpath.description:
Add these directories to PYTHONPATH to search for plugins
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#pythonpath

remote_ca_certs_path.description:
Path to a PEM file containing CA certificates used for verifying secure connections to `[GLOBAL].remote_execution_address` and `[GLOBAL].remote_store_address`
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_ca_certs_path

remote_cache_read.description:
Whether to enable reading from a remote cache
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_cache_read

remote_cache_rpc_concurrency.description:
The number of concurrent requests allowed to the remote cache service
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_cache_rpc_concurrency

remote_cache_rpc_timeout_millis.description:
Timeout value for remote cache RPCs in milliseconds
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_cache_rpc_timeout_millis

remote_cache_warnings.description:
How frequently to log remote cache failures at the `warn` log level
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_cache_warnings

remote_cache_write.description:
Whether to enable writing results to a remote cache
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_cache_write

remote_execution.description:
Enables remote workers for increased parallelism. (Alpha)
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_execution

remote_execution_address.description:
The URI of a server used as a remote execution scheduler
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_execution_address

remote_execution_append_only_caches_base.description:
Sets the base path to use when setting up an append-only cache for a process running remotely
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_execution_append_only_caches_base_path

remote_execution_extra_platform_properti.description:
Platform properties to set on remote execution requests
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_execution_extra_platform_properties

remote_execution_headers.description:
Headers to set on remote execution requests
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_execution_headers

remote_execution_overall_deadline_secs.description:
Overall timeout in seconds for each remote execution request from time of submission
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_execution_overall_deadline_secs

remote_execution_rpc_concurrency.description:
The number of concurrent requests allowed to the remote execution service
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_execution_rpc_concurrency

remote_instance_name.description:
Name of the remote instance to use by remote caching and remote execution
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_instance_name

remote_oauth_bearer_token_path.description:
Path to a file containing an oauth token to use for gGRPC connections to `[GLOBAL].remote_execution_address` and `[GLOBAL].remote_store_address`
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_oauth_bearer_token_path

remote_store_address.description:
The URI of a server used for the remote file store
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_store_address

remote_store_batch_api_size_limit.description:
The maximum total size of blobs allowed to be sent in a single batch API call to the remote store
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_store_batch_api_size_limit

remote_store_chunk_bytes.description:
Size in bytes of chunks transferred to/from the remote file store
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_store_chunk_bytes

remote_store_headers.description:
Headers to set on remote store requests
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_store_headers

remote_store_rpc_concurrency.description:
The number of concurrent requests allowed to the remote store service
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_store_rpc_concurrency

remote_store_rpc_retries.description:
Number of times to retry any RPC to the remote store before giving up
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_store_rpc_retries

remote_store_rpc_timeout_millis.description:
Timeout value for remote store RPCs (not including streaming requests) in milliseconds
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#remote_store_rpc_timeout_millis

rule_threads_core.description:
The number of threads to keep active and ready to execute `@rule` logic (see also: `--rule-threads-max`)
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#rule_threads_core

rule_threads_max.description:
The maximum number of threads to use to execute `@rule` logic
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#rule_threads_max

session_end_tasks_timeout.description:
The time in seconds to wait for still-running "session end" tasks to complete before finishing completion of a Pants invocation. "Session end" tasks include, for example, writing data that was generated during the applicable Pants invocation to a configured remote cache
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#session_end_tasks_timeout

show_log_target.description:
Display the target where a log message originates in that log message's output
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#show_log_target

spec_files.description:
Read additional specs (target addresses, files, and/or globs), one per line, from these files
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#spec_files

stats_record_option_scopes.description:
Option scopes to record in stats on run completion
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#stats_record_option_scopes

streaming_workunits_complete_async.description:
True if stats recording should be allowed to complete asynchronously when `pantsd` is enabled
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#streaming_workunits_complete_async

streaming_workunits_level.description:
The level of workunits that will be reported to streaming workunit event receivers
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#streaming_workunits_level

streaming_workunits_report_interval.description:
Interval in seconds between when streaming workunit event receivers will be polled
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#streaming_workunits_report_interval

subproject_roots.description:
Paths that correspond with build roots for any subproject that this project depends on
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#subproject_roots

tag.description:
Include only targets with these tags (optional '+' prefix) or without these tags ('-' prefix)
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#tag

unmatched_build_file_globs.description:
What to do when files and globs specified in BUILD files, such as in the `sources` field, cannot be found
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#unmatched_build_file_globs

unmatched_cli_globs.description:
What to do when command line arguments, e.g. files and globs like `dir::`, cannot be found
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#unmatched_cli_globs

verify_config.description:
Verify that all config file values correspond to known options
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#verify_config

watch_filesystem.description:
Set to False if Pants should not watch the filesystem for changes. `pantsd` or `loop` may not be enabled
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-global#watch_filesystem

anonymous-telemetry.description: Options related to sending anonymous stats to the Pants project, to aid development.

enabled.description:
Whether to send anonymous telemetry to the Pants project
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-anonymous-telemetry#enabled

repo_id.description:
An anonymized ID representing this repo
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-anonymous-telemetry#repo_id

args.description:
Arguments to pass directly to Autoflake, e.g. `--autoflake-args='--remove-all-unused-imports --target-version=py37 --quiet'`
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-autoflake#args

console_script.description:
The console script for the tool
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-autoflake#console_script

entry_point.description:
The entry point for the tool
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-autoflake#entry_point

install_from_resolve.description:
If specified, install the tool using the lockfile for this named resolve
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-autoflake#install_from_resolve

interpreter_constraints.description:
Python interpreter constraints for this tool
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-autoflake#interpreter_constraints

requirements.description:
If install_from_resolve is specified, install these requirements, at the versions provided by the specified resolve's lockfile
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-autoflake#requirements

skip.description:
If true, don't use Autoflake when running `pants fmt` and `pants lint`
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-autoflake#skip

args.description:
Arguments to pass directly to Black, e.g. `--black-args='--target-version=py37 --quiet'`
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-black#args

config.description:
Path to a TOML config file understood by Black (https://github.com/psf/black#configuration-format)
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-black#config

config_discovery.description:
If true, Pants will include any relevant pyproject.toml config files during runs
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-black#config_discovery

console_script.description:
The console script for the tool
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-black#console_script

entry_point.description:
The entry point for the tool
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-black#entry_point

install_from_resolve.description:
If specified, install the tool using the lockfile for this named resolve
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-black#install_from_resolve

interpreter_constraints.description:
Python interpreter constraints for this tool
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-black#interpreter_constraints

requirements.description:
If install_from_resolve is specified, install these requirements, at the versions provided by the specified resolve's lockfile
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-black#requirements

skip.description:
If true, don't use Black when running `pants fmt` and `pants lint`
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-black#skip

build-deprecations-fixer.description:
A tool/plugin for fixing BUILD file deprecations (where possible).

This includes deprecations for: - Renamed targets - Renamed fields

skip.description:
If true, don't use BUILD Deprecations Fixer when running `pants fix`
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-build-deprecations-fixer#skip

changed.description:
Tell Pants to detect what files and targets have changed from Git.

See https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/advanced-target-selection.

dependents.description:
Include direct or transitive dependents of changed targets
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-changed#dependents

diffspec.description:
Calculate changes contained within a given Git spec (commit range/SHA/ref)
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-changed#diffspec

since.description:
Calculate changes since this Git spec (commit range/SHA/ref)
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-changed#since

check.description: Run type checking or the lightest variant of compilation available for a language.

only.description:
Only run these checkers and skip all others
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-check#only

check-default-tools.description: Options for checking that external tool default locations are correctly typed.

cli.description: Options for configuring CLI behavior, such as command line aliases.

coursier.description: A dependency resolver for the Maven ecosystem. (https://get-coursier.io/)

known_versions.description:
Known versions to verify downloads against
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-coursier#known_versions

repos.description:
Maven style repositories to resolve artifacts from
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-coursier#repos

url_platform_mapping.description:
A dictionary mapping platforms to strings to be used when generating the URL to download the tool
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-coursier#url_platform_mapping

url_template.description:
URL to download the tool, either as a single binary file or a compressed file (e.g. zip file)
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-coursier#url_template

use_unsupported_version.description:
What action to take in case the requested version of coursier is not supported
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-coursier#use_unsupported_version

coverage-py.description: Configuration for Python test coverage measurement.

config.description:
Path to an INI or TOML config file understood by coverage.py (https://coverage.readthedocs.io/en/stable/config.html)
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-coverage-py#config

config_discovery.description:
If true, Pants will include any relevant config files during runs (`.coveragerc`, `setup.cfg`, `tox.ini`, and `pyproject.toml`)
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-coverage-py#config_discovery

console_script.description:
The console script for the tool
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-coverage-py#console_script

entry_point.description:
The entry point for the tool
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-coverage-py#entry_point

fail_under.description:
Fail if the total combined coverage percentage for all tests is less than this number
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-coverage-py#fail_under

filter.description:
A list of Python modules or filesystem paths to use in the coverage report, e.g. `['helloworld_test', 'helloworld/util/dirutil']`
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-coverage-py#filter

global_report.description:
If true, Pants will generate a global coverage report
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-coverage-py#global_report

install_from_resolve.description:
If specified, install the tool using the lockfile for this named resolve
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-coverage-py#install_from_resolve

interpreter_constraints.description:
Python interpreter constraints for this tool
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-coverage-py#interpreter_constraints

output_dir.description:
Path to write the Pytest Coverage report to
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-coverage-py#output_dir

report.description:
Which coverage report type(s) to emit
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-coverage-py#report

requirements.description:
If install_from_resolve is specified, install these requirements, at the versions provided by the specified resolve's lockfile
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-coverage-py#requirements

debug-adapter.description:
Options used to configure and launch a Debug Adapter server.

See https://microsoft.github.io/debug-adapter-protocol/ for more information.

host.description:
The hostname to use when launching the server
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-debug-adapter#host

port.description:
The port to use when launching the server
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-debug-adapter#port

debugpy.description: An implementation of the Debug Adapter Protocol for Python (https://github.com/microsoft/debugpy).

args.description:
Arguments to pass directly to debugpy, e.g. `--debugpy-args='--log-to-stderr'`
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-debugpy#args

console_script.description:
The console script for the tool
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-debugpy#console_script

entry_point.description:
The entry point for the tool
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-debugpy#entry_point

install_from_resolve.description:
If specified, install the tool using the lockfile for this named resolve
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-debugpy#install_from_resolve

interpreter_constraints.description:
Python interpreter constraints for this tool
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-debugpy#interpreter_constraints

requirements.description:
If install_from_resolve is specified, install these requirements, at the versions provided by the specified resolve's lockfile
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-debugpy#requirements

dependees.description: List all targets that depend on any of the input files/targets.

closed.description:
Include the input targets in the output, along with the dependents
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-dependees#closed

output_file.description:
Output the goal's stdout to this file
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-dependees#output_file

sep.description:
String to use to separate lines in line-oriented output
https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/reference-dependees#sep

dependencies.description: List the dependencies of the input files/targets.

filter.description:
Filter the input targets based on various criteria.

Most of the filtering options below are comma-separated lists of filtering criteria, with an implied logical OR between them, so that a target passes the filter if it matches any of the criteria in the list. A '-' prefix inverts the sense of the entire comma-separated list, so that a target passes the filter only if it matches none of the criteria in the list.

Each of the filtering options may be specified multiple times, with an implied logical AND between them.

See https://go.dev/blog/generate for details.

nodejs-test.description:
Options for package.json script configured tests.

Your preferred test runner is configured via the `package.json#scripts.test` field.

The only expectation from pants is that the `test` script can accept a variadic number of path arguments, relative to the package.json, and that any configuration files are `file` dependencies to the `package_json`.

Simple example:

Consider a directory-layout:

├── BUILD
├── src/
│   ├── BUILD
│   ├── test/
│   │   ├── BUILD
│   │   └── index.test.js
│   └── index.js
└── package.json

where package.json contains

# package.json
{
    ...
    "scripts": {
        "test": "mocha"
    },
    "devDependencies: {
        ...
    }
}


Executing `pants test src/test/index.test.js` will cause the equivalent of `mocha src/test/index.test.js` to run.

run.description:
Runs a binary target.

This goal propagates the return code of the underlying executable.

If your application can safely be restarted while it is running, you can pass `restartable=True` on your binary target (for supported types), and the `run` goal will automatically restart them as all relevant files change. This can be particularly useful for server applications.

update-build-files.description:
Format and fix safe deprecations in BUILD files.

This does not handle the full Pants upgrade. You must still manually change `pants_version` in `pants.toml` and you may need to manually address some deprecations. See https://www.pantsbuild.org/v2.17/docs/upgrade-tips for upgrade tips.

This goal is run without arguments. It will run over all BUILD files in your project.
